definition: to resemble/to be like/to look as if/such as/appearance/image/portrait/image under a mapping (math.)

sentences.english: By drawing on his own culture, Jesus shared his vision of the kingdom of God.
sentences.chinese: 耶稣也通过汲取自身文化来分享他对上帝国的异像。

sentences.english: You have had the vision, but you are not there yet by any means.
sentences.chinese: 你们虽然看到了异像，却还没有到达那里。

sentences.english: And this phenomenon was accompanied by visions and trances .
sentences.chinese: 这种现象是伴随着异像和出神状态而来。

sentences.english: Day and night, visions flitted before him.
sentences.chinese: 异像在他面前日日夜夜地掠过。

definition: lit. to descend to earth (of an immortal)/to be born
meteorological or astronomical phenomenon (e.g. rainbow or eclipse)
to shine brightly/(fig.) to show promise/to be on the up and up
omen/sign (that sth is about to happen)/warning sign
to concentrate/to think what you're doing
divine light (around the Buddha)/a halo/a miraculous column of light/(slang) jolly good!
